<<<<<<< HEAD
An antidote against the infection of VVilliam Rogers's book, mis-called, The Christian-Quaker distinguished from the apostate and innovator whereby the envy, falshood, slander, errors, and false doctrines contained in the said book, being plainly laid open, the charge of apostacy and innovation is justly retorted upon W.R. and his adherents / by Thomas Ellwood. Ellwood, Thomas, 1639-1713.
[12], 234 p.
Printed for Benjamin Clark ..., London : 1682.
Errata: prelim. p. [12]. Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

Ellwood, Thomas, 1639-1713.
[12], 234 p.
Printed for Benjamin Clark ..., London : 1682.
Errata: prelim. p. [12]. Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
